example[0]: The organization is gearing up for a convention in May.
example[1]: Fast food restaurants are geared up to serve thousands of people daily.
note[0]: gear up/be geared up to do something
definition[1]: to prepare for something that is about to happen, usually something exciting or difficult
example[2]: The Postal Service is gearing up to absorb some of the United Parcels Service business if thereâ€™s a strike.
example[3]: The finance house has been gearing up for a major push into investment banking.
